intro: Rubroshorea rugosa, commonly known as the rough-horned fern, is a unique member of the Polypodiaceae family. It is characterized by its rugged, serrated leaf margins and a compact, upright growth habit. Native to tropical and subtropical regions, this plant thrives in moist, shaded environments. Its rhizomes are fibrous and often used in traditional medicine. The plant's foliage provides habitat for various small insects and invertebrates.
